defs: with one's own hand; (doing, giving, etc.) oneself.
a heavy, rectangular or circular piece of wood with a long pole fastened to it, used to level the surface by striking on it; a ramming implement.
to touch with the hand.
to reach one's hand; to reach.

to touch another's palm in making a solemn promise or pledge.
an implement that has become useless.
a morsel or lump of food taken in the hand.
to eat in morsels.
(fig.) to eat or eat up hungrily, greedily or voraciously; to devour.
to consume or destroy with devastating force.
(the bone of hand or fore-arm) to break; to fracture.
to break another's hand, forearm or fracture the bone thereof.

a kind of ornament for wearing round the wrist.
a band of cloth or grass tied round the waist.
the act, fact or an instance of fracturing of the bone of one's hand or fore-arm.

anything one has to do; a task; a work; a job.
skill in using one's hands; hand-dexterity.
the act and practice or an instance of cheating.
the condition of being an agriculturist, farmer.

a strong man.
the state or fact of excelling; the possession of good qualities or abilities to an eminent or unusual degree; surpassing merit, skill or worth; excellence.

to be accomplished; to be successful.
to submit; to offer.
to occur; to take place.

marked or extraordinary courage.
to join both the palms, raising them to chest level, forehead or above, as in greeting, salutation or supplication.
a covering of wool, leather, cotton, etc., for the hand, worn esp. for protection against cold or dirt, and usu. having separate fingers; a protective glove.
a small hand-pump or syringe for spraying.
any machine that is operated with the hand (not using electric or other power); a hand-machine.
a handful of rice for giving alms.
a person's particular style of writing.
a letter or letters written by a person; handwriting.

deception; cheating; hypocrisy.

a narrative account; a statement; a description.
a written order from a person of authority.

a declaration or statement made under oath or affirmation by a witness in a court, often in response to questioning, to establish a fact; a testimony.
from; through.
the strength of one's hand or arm.
the condition or fact of being possible; possibility.

to move one's hand.

to turn or get turn upside down grain etc. with the hand (as to make it dry evenly and thoroughly).

to intervene, meddle (in others' business).
to engage oneself in a business, field of activity, etc. (for a relatively a very short period).

to repair or reset (the roof-tiles of a house).
to turn upside down the grain, by running the fingers through it (to dry evenly).

to gain; to get; to have (possession of).
